pullRequest.body:
Like in #9655, these instances tend to be slow to fail, so we should assign them a low priority.

Zulip discussions:
https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Algebra.2Eid.20for.20IntermediateField https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Timeout.20in.20Submodule.20.28.F0.9D.93.9E.20K.29.20.28.F0.9D.93.9E.20K.29


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: !bench
One of the docstrings should be talking about `SMul R' R` I guess

> One of the docstrings should be talking about `SMul R' R` I guess

Well spotted!

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/1d7ceb6a-c7e8-4b20-bdf0-8b716f89dbbe) for commit 779e17e63b0013f60290942915db271cc2eb8027.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/a2c07645-43a6-45bf-8bf4-fdbfbca33ceb/to/1d7ceb6a-c7e8-4b20-bdf0-8b716f89dbbe) against commit 5a0540a5b10114a7759f528618675c6ffd9701fa:
```diff
  Benchmark                                  Metric         Change
  ================================================================
+ ~Mathlib.RingTheory.AlgebraicIndependent   instructions   -14.2%
```

It sounds like @sgouezel â€™s concerns are addressed. I re-iterate that having instances that serve no purpose is in principle not good but I leave any further decisions to you. Thanks.

bors delegate+

:v: Vierkantor can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

> Subalgebra.algebra' no but I didn't try terribly hard. IntermediateField.algebra' yes. I don't like having instances laying around that serve no purpose. But if people feel strongly about keeping, I won't fight.

According to commit eeeeedb603545cf6d4f8be8af0998309045b200d, no theory breaks if we make the required changes. But I'm not convinced this is the right way to go, so I'll make a follow up PR that we can make independently.

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7642839167/job/20823431657)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7642839167/job/20823431080)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7642839167/job/20823430757)
I'll apply the changes once the benchmark is done.

How low is the priority `low`? IMHO it shouldn't be too low here, because it is already specific to `Subalgebra R A`, so it should have higher priority than instances that are completely general. Would a priority of 300 be low enough that more specific instances would be tried first?

Also, does switching the order (i.e., using
```
[CommSemiring R'] [Algebra R' A] [SMul R' R]
```
make it faster to fail?
Can we get away with them not being instances? I'll test once I get into my office.

> switching the order

In [the example on Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Algebra.2Eid.20for.20IntermediateField/near/417428908) this doesn't seem to help unfortunately: the `Algebra E E` instance now takes 71 seconds (!) to find instead of 43 before this change or 0.5 after.

> How low is the priority `low`?

According to `Init.Notation`: `low = 100`, `mid = 500`, `default = 1000` and `high = 10000`.

> Would a priority of 300 be low enough that more specific instances would be tried first?

Any priority between 0 and 999 doesn't seem to change the results of the `IntermediateField` test case. So maybe `priority := mid` (i.e. 500)? Or we could even declare a new macro for priority, so we can write `priority := generalizedScalarInstancePrio` for all three of these instances of the same shape. (Better name suggestions very much welcome!)

Wow. But how come this instance is even tried at some point, since there is no `Subalgebra` here? Does it try to fill in the typeclasses before realizing that the stuff it's looking at is not of the form `Subalgebra ...`?
I'd prefer an explicit number for the priority, because then it's easier to see if you're above or below, and adjust things as needed.

> But how come this instance is even tried at some point, since there is no `Subalgebra` here?

Coercing `E` to a sort gives `@Subtype L fun x => x âˆˆ E`, and the `âˆˆ` operator comes from the following:
```
instance : SetLike (IntermediateField K L) L :=
  âŸ¨fun S => S.toSubalgebra.carrier, by
    rintro âŸ¨âŸ¨âŸ©âŸ© âŸ¨âŸ¨âŸ©âŸ©
    simp âŸ©
```
So unfolding effectively casts `E` to a subalgebra and apply succeeds!

> Can we get away with them not being instances? I'll test once I get into my office. 

`Subalgebra.algebra'` no but I didn't try terribly hard. `IntermediateField.algebra'` yes. 

I don't like having instances laying around that serve no purpose. But if people feel strongly about keeping, I won't fight.

```suggestion
instance (priority := 500) algebra' [CommSemiring R'] [SMul R' R] [Algebra R' A]
```

```suggestion
instance (priority := 500) algebra' {K'} [CommSemiring K'] [SMul K' K] [Algebra K' L]
```

```suggestion
before failing, it will cause a search through all `SMul R' R` instances,
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - perf: de-prioritize `Subalgebra.algebra'` and `IntermediateField.algebra'`
